column5: Just curious where everyone launches who fishes the inner bay. Tomorrow will be a vaca day for me and I want to get my dad's boat out for some bassin.  Any help would be appreciated.  Thanks,  Chris

I've launched out of Old Cut a few times (if you can call it launching with my twelve foot tinny LOL). It's not fancy there, but it's a relaxed atmosphere, they're decent people and they have good minnows too!
I have never heard of Old Cut?  Can you give me more details. Is this close to the inner bays?
What are you throwing in the inner bay? Mostly tubes, spinners, or live bait?  I cant wait
I much prefer the Long Point Provincial Park ramp. Last year it was $9 and an excellent ramp with a cleaning station and lots of parking.
Thanks I think i will give that a try

We were using minnows (which mostly caught perch), caught a pike on a blue/chrome ripplin redfin and bass were caught on perch patterned lipless crankbaits, one was Matzuo which I lost and the other is a cordell super spot in firetiger. We tried throwing a spinner bait, but strangely, no takers. Good luck.
